intro: Dinebra somalensis, commonly known as the Somali thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
